Reviews.Title: I love this phone!
Reviews.Author: MasaRyou
Reviews.Content: It's such an upgrade from my old Net10 phone which had no accessories and couldn't hold more than a few apps. I use Net10 and I wanted a better phone and I chose this. It's awesome, it doesn't freeze, it handles even the most intense of apps and I've yet to regret it. The only thing is that the battery sucks, so I wouldn't recommend overly using it unless you get a portable charger or you don't surf the internet that often, or are by a plug. This thing gets charged twice a day. One time I fell asleep without charging it, it was about 87% when I went to bed and when I woke up about 7 hours later it was at 40% so make sure you always have the charger. Other than that it's a perfect phone, and seeing as I already had portable chargers I think this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy S2
Reviews.Author: Sleeper
Reviews.Content: This is the best phone I have had to date.  It's very fast, can handle everything that I have thrown at it.  I can not say enough about this phone.  I would recommend it to anyone...... So if you are on the fence about this phone, jump off and run and get it.

Reviews.Title: First smartphone
Reviews.Author: Jason D.
Reviews.Content: I have owned this phone for about a month and am very pleased.  Having been a Sprint customer using non-smartphones, I realized that I had been paying too much and not getting a lot in return.  The phone has done everything I wanted it to thus far.Good:It takes good pictures and video.It is a solid balance of screen size and overall phone dimensions (not overly cumbersome to tote around)Voice recognition and Swype work wellScreen/capacitive buttons are responsiveFairly priced (for non-Sprint CDMA network)Android interface is easy to learnNot so good:Phone can run through battery if using heavily (browsing pages or syncing data constantly)Older Android version (this is an academic issue for me because I have never used later versions of Android and don't really know what functionality I am missing)No 4G (another academic point because where I live doesn't really have a  robust 4G network and I usually use WiFi anyway)Overall:I dig this phone quite a bit. I was able to purchase it through Amazon and avoided shipping/tax.  I did use my savings to purchase 3rd party rechargeable batteries which have been invaluable and I would recommend it for anyone considering this phone.

Reviews.Title: Nice Phone for pre-paid!
Reviews.Author: thomas duperry
Reviews.Content: This phone runs great! I upgraded from the LG Optimus and immediately the screen size was a huge difference. Finding a case can be a bit difficult. (Look for Model # S959G) (At&T;, and Verizon have other versions of this phone with none compatible cases for this phone.) Also, the battery life can be a drain. Install a WiFi toggle and a Data toggle asap. Maybe a battery manager as well. That way the battery will last much longer. On the plus side, this phone benchmarks well. Maybe not compared to it's younger brother, the S3, but I haven't found an application issue yet. Rugged as I work construction and this thing handles my work well. A recommended buy all around :) One last note; I bought this phone from here because the Net 10 Website said it wasn't available in my area. Well, I'm from central Maine, and there is no problems here at all. It's a marketing game Net 10 plays with it's customers, and that's not fair. So If you have coverage for At&t;, Sprint, or Us Cell, This phone *Should* work great for you at 3G.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone!
Reviews.Author: sgrazier
Reviews.Content: I love this phone!  Does everything that I expected it to do and then some!  I bought this phone for my son as a Christmas present and he was so happy!  Loves It!

Reviews.Title: Good phone but...
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Net 10 DOES NOT allow you to upgrade the android system software... If i would have known this i would have bought an unlock version and transfer service to NET 10...If your looking at this phone and you can afford to buy an unlocked version... DO SO... Its a way better deal and will allow the phone to be used longer.  This is still a good phone in my opinion.... the only issues i have had are (1) a couple of games that crash but that could be from me leaving them running to long AND (2)  THE BATTERY... some days it might last 11-12 hours and other times it will last for 30-40 hours... Running the same apps??? Not really sure what's up with that... the only thing i can think of is that this battery has a sweet spot for when it needs to be charged for optimal battery usage....  This phone plays movies, music, youtube videos great and does email a lot better than i thought it would... I have had this phone for 5 weeks and have had less than a handful of videos that would'nt play.... And i watch alot of videos (football games, youtube, movies, sportscenter)

Reviews.Title: Nice phone
Reviews.Author: Kim Mihelitch "Kim"
Reviews.Content: It has good resolution, time display is large for easy reading. Still investigating all the features. Battery life could be longer, have tried some apps for this.

Reviews.Title: worth the money
Reviews.Author: Filo Beddoe
Reviews.Content: Love, love,love this phone. Will still be relavent years down the line. I encourage anyone looking for a great smart phone to spend the money and get this phone. I have had mine for three months and i still love it. I can not imagine going back to a dumb phone. This phone does as much as todays tablets and it's a phone. Way cool !!!

Reviews.Title: awesome phone!
Reviews.Author: Alicia "alicia2686"
Reviews.Content: Had this phone almost a month now. I love it! Samsung did a great job. Very thin and light weight.

Reviews.Title: it is cool
Reviews.Author: Derek Smith
Reviews.Content: it is cool. i really like the way it is so light in my hand, makes texting so much easier

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: Sandra J. Larsen
Reviews.Content: what a great phone, i had a cheaper smartphone, but this one is the best.  it does everything and more i need.

Reviews.Title: Phone is good for android
Reviews.Author: Dolores
Reviews.Content: Have had an Iphone for the last 5 years. Having to learn the Android format. So far so good. Just taking time to get used to the different format. Android has interesting apps that Apple did not.

Reviews.Title: I love this phone had it since July!!!
Reviews.Author: Katchira Yatsumi
Reviews.Content: I still even now am really really glad that I bought this phone I still can't believe I was originally using the Samsung Galaxy Discover because the weight difference and the size of the screen! Plus I'm glad for the LED Light its been helpful lol. Also the screen visuals are nice and clear, bright, and just look nice and clean first thing I noticed after going through the set-up process of the phone once turned on. The app functionality every once and awhile will get a little lagging but that's mostly when it overheats a bit (probably cuz of the gingerbread OS) or long excessive use. The other problem I tend to get is if I leave my phone on all night without unplugging it is that after unlocking the screen will be frozen but I've just been turning my phone off at night to prevent that.... Other than a couple "glitches" or "bugs" the phone itself definitely suits my needs. Also the total space the phone has is #1.USB Storage-11.36GB Total and #2.Device Memory-is approximately 2GB not entirely sure what is was from the beginning currently I still have 1.46GB free hope that helps!! ^_^

Reviews.Title: Great phone for less!
Reviews.Author: Antonio L Quinones Jr.
Reviews.Content: This is a great phone. Unlimited talk, text, and 3G data for $49.65 a month(after taxes and fees) when you're on the $45.00 auto refill enrollment monthly plan on Net10wireless.com. Most games and music works on this device. Wi-Fi connection is recommended for downloading and streaming. Been using the phone for a while, no problems. Makes a great gift. I would highly recommend this phone to everyone.

Reviews.Title: finally, a phone that fits
Reviews.Author: Larry D. Albea "Larry Dean"
Reviews.Content: i have been using net10 for 7 or 8 years now and am very happy with their service and plan, you can buy 3rd party phones for net10 bu i do not recommend it as they can actually use other carriers for your signal.  i bought this net10 version of the s-2 and i love it! it is modern enough for me and i have found everything about it easy to figure out....except how to find my home page on it.  either way now that i am back to a real net10 phone they use att cell towers and signal strength is back up to pretty good levels even in the concrete bunker that i work in!

Reviews.Title: Love this phone
Reviews.Author: Kristen M. Zachares
Reviews.Content: I needed a smart phone to fully take advantage of Net10's unlimited plan but didn't want to get a iPhone because I don't want to deal with Apple and their techs.  This phone is perfect- easy to use, has a large screen, plenty of built in memory, two way camera, etc.

Reviews.Title: nice phone
Reviews.Author: emory dawn
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with this phone. I had a dumb phone before, it was a wanna be touchscreen so I have no complaints!

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy S2
Reviews.Author: Allan English
Reviews.Content: I have been very happy with this phone, even though it may take a while to learn it because there is so much it does! It is the first smartphone for me and my wife and it has been pretty easy to figure how to use.

Reviews.Title: I love this phone!!
Reviews.Author: Erykah "Erykah"
Reviews.Content: I was wanting an unlimited plan which I could use a smartphone with that wasn't going to cost over $100 a month. I found one and I love this phone! Perfect for texting, quick lookups on the internet, and online banking! This phone is as good as a little  computer in your hand.

Reviews.Title: I love this Phone
Reviews.Author: Alain N. Forbang "Alain"
Reviews.Content: Good phone for a good deal. But too bad, the monthly data package has now been limited by net10 to 1.5G. But overall the phone  has been excellent in all its functions. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: Tara Murphy
Reviews.Content: This phone has been great, but it dies a lot! That (so far [I've had it 7 months]) is my only problem. If any problems arise I will update this ASAP.

Reviews.Title: very nice phone
Reviews.Author: tamiam
Reviews.Content: bought for brother as he needed a replacement phone. It's the same exact phone he already had and works great. he (and I) are very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Overall, Excellent. Battery life, not so much.
Reviews.Author: Dan Johnson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone because I used to work for Sprint, and this was the best on the market at the time. It's quite durable, moderate speed, and connects to the network easily. The camera is nothing to sneeze at, and the addition of a contract-free tracfone makes this, even two years later, still pretty top of the line.If you need good battery life, however, this is not the phone for you. It falls a bit shy of the 8 hour talking time claimed by the manufacturer, expect about 6-7 hours instead. If you keep your charger somewhat near, this shouldn't be a problem, but it's a bit of a battery hog.Of note: Be sure to buy a Net10 Unlimited card with this. If you buy a 750 minute, or anything below unlimited, Net10 will refuse to activate your phone. Also, minutes on another phone are not transferable, so waste most of your other plan before switching over.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy S II Android Prepaid Phone (Net10)
Reviews.Author: Simon
Reviews.Content: This phone is great. Is good not to pay a monthly charge to the larger companies. Does everything I need. Love the unlimited data, messages and phone calls, cannot beat it.

Reviews.Title: hot phone
Reviews.Author: Celeste  Speed
Reviews.Content: The phone gets really hot. I tried buying new batteries but still gets hot and shuts off on me alot.

Reviews.Title: good phone but old
Reviews.Author: DEEJAYNIGHT
Reviews.Content: I love this phone but the phone is so old that the price is not worth it sprint won't be supporting 4 g WiMAX no more if you wanna buy it you will just enjoy the phone till 2015 from their you need to buy a new phone or if you lucky they let you keep 3g only if you lucky if you even more lucky they put 4g lte but I don't thinkso s2 is going down & out in 2015 so sad :/

Reviews.Title: needs improvement
Reviews.Author: kevin Duggan
Reviews.Content: Great phone, but I can't use my navigator. Even when the sky is blue and very few clouds. And still can't use it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung S II and Net 10
Reviews.Author: R.H. "Pepsionice"
Reviews.Content: Some folks have complained over Net10, but my experiences have been positive.  Took me ten minutes after the card arrived to square away the account and have full access.  No issues in my region or as I traveled to VA.  Always worked.As for Galaxy S II, the three positives are: easy to figure out, screen is small but sized right to fit in my pocket and camera is decent (not five-star quality but good enough).Now, speaking toward the battery.  If you run GPS and various functions throughout the day, and check emails eight times a day, and make five or six calls per day.....then this battery will be completely run down by 18 hours.  If you simply check your emails once a day, make five calls, and never run GPS....it'll last 48 hours.  So I would advise you to carry a charger around with you, and in the car, and check the battery symbol once in a while.This is a phone that I'd advise any light-user or older person with limited knowledge on new technology to buy.  It's not overly fancy or highly technical.  If you wanted a better camera...then buy a camera.  If you wanted a I-Phone....then buy a I-phone.  This is the general all-purpose phone and just accept that.  If you are on the go, and really use the phone alot....I'd advise you to go ahead and buy a second battery to have around and fully charged.  Most folks don't need that much connectivity and can avoid any second battery.

Reviews.Title: The phone so far is good, it's the mistake of the PIN & Plan
Reviews.Author: Mickeymouse
Reviews.Content: You sent me the the wrong pin with the phone making it 60 days and not 90. I don't want to have to return it but... I will update my Eval. once this is resolved.Thanks,Scott

Reviews.Title: I love this phone!
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: I recieved myphone rather quickly and in brand new condition! So far after a month no problems with the phone and I highly recommend it for android users.

Reviews.Title: The Best Phone
Reviews.Author: C. Egeler
Reviews.Content: This phone was more or less a gift from my son as he has been gifting money to Amazon for different occasions for me.  I finally decided I wanted this phone to replace an LG phone with Net 10.  I love this phone because it is fast, holds a lot of stuff, takes great pics, videos and I even recorded an "Elvis" Concert with Chris MacDonald on it.  It was clear as a bell.I know it's not the 3 or 4, but it's good enough for me. You will love it as much as I do, I am sure

Reviews.Title: Samsung Phone remarks
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: After review of all information in book, it's very easy to use.Great pics from the camera. Easy to carry and can slip in a pocket so neat.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: swimmer
Reviews.Content: Love this phone so much my daughter got one too.  Only problem I have is in a Partnered 2g area through ATT I cannot get 2g and have to rely on wireless when available.  This is when I travel toa certain location, if someone has a suggestion on how to fix this would be great.  Otherwise where we live all is great with this phone and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: 3G Phone
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: This is 4G phone. Altough net10 does not offer 4G. So yes this is not the best value through net10.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy S II
Reviews.Author: William Hinkle
Reviews.Content: This phone is by far the best upgrade I've made.  My last was a Droid and this is a great improvement.  The phone has so much to offer and being with Net10 my bill can remain reasonable($45.00). I've only had it a couple of months and still learning about all that it offers. No dropped calls yet and a great phone!  Shipping was great also. Would like to see the price come down a little since the galaxy 4 is out now. Amazon got it to me on Saturday in 1 day ordered on Fri afternoon.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: kyjoe9
Reviews.Content: the phone is great and has a powerful dual core processor. my only problem is the gps on my phone does not work.  other than that a great phone

Reviews.Title: Phones lacking some needed software
Reviews.Author: natasha welch
Reviews.Content: I ordered 2 of these phones at the same time. They weren't packaged well as the box it was delivered in was busted open when i received it. Also even tho most of the features on these phones are awesome, i believe i ended up getting 2 with problems. They are not equipped with the correct Apns so net 10 had to send us new sim cards just so we could get them activated. But net 10 can't do anything about the phones lacking the correct apns so we can't get data on either of these phones which sucks since that was the main thing we looked forward to. Would have been 5 stars had they  been correct working phones since i did pay a pretty penny for them.

Reviews.Title: no sd card
Reviews.Author: STEVEN
Reviews.Content: the only thing i didnt like is that the package said that a 4g micro sd card was with it and there is not one

Reviews.Title: NET 10 is the worst company in the world
Reviews.Author: James G
Reviews.Content: The phone is mediocre but the company is one of the most frustrating experiences I have had. After purchasing two of these we have abandoned the idea of using NET 10 and went with another carrier. Customer service can barely speak English and EVERY time we called it was like they had never done it before.

Reviews.Title: Pricey
Reviews.Author: Samwise
Reviews.Content: The Galaxy S II looks like a nice phone but at $349. it would be a better value with a newer OS like 4.0 .Is the OS upgradeable?  Even with an upgrade to the OS, it's still a 3G phone.  I think I'll wait for more.  If you want to buy a 3G phone, the Motorola Defy looks like a better $ value at $199. .  It's slower and has a smaller viewing screen but after all it has the same OS as the Galaxy S II and runs on the same 3G network!

Reviews.Title: Beware! If you're transferring your old number prepare to wait days...
Reviews.Author: Camper Van Beethoven
Reviews.Content: This review is only for the setup shenanigans I've encountered so far as I haven't used the phone yet.Since this phone is only useful on NET10's network this still applies as it's part of the purchase.If you go to their web page and look around, it looks like all you'll have to do is enter some info about your old and new phones, click a few buttons and in an hour or so you'll be talking on your new Net10 phone.This is only true if you want to use the new number that's programmed on the SIM that comes with the phone.Nobody tells you this, but you click through the activation steps to program your phone with your old number on the web page expecting to be off and going in 10 minutes but at the last click it just tosses you out of the process to a front page w/o explaination!So you think you did something wrong and you try it again 2 more times before you give up and call cust svc.It turns out if you want to transfer your old number (mine from ATT) it will take DAYS as they have to send you a new SIM card programmed with that old number, ALSO you'll have to go to a local retailer to buy your first month's load at full $50 price which provides a PIN to use to register your account with them. This can't be done with a CC online for some reason, (likely fraud).At least the CS rep was extremely nice and was very patient but so far it's been a far cry from what's been advertised.More to come...

Reviews.Title: I have a question about this phone
Reviews.Author: roger b
Reviews.Content: Can you "Voice" Dial from your Bluetooth? I mean, is it "Really" a Hands free phone? Or do you have to hold it, click a button and say a contacts name, or can you leave in it's holster, reach up and touch a button on your bluetooth, say a name, and make the call? So many phones say "Hands Free" but in reality, they're the furthest thing from Hands Free. Like the LG Optimus Extreme, I paid $150 for a "Hands Free" phone because I''m a truck driver and if I get caught with a phone in my hand while driving, it a $375 fine, the LG Optimus Extreme is NOT a Hands Free phone, so it was a waste of $150 for me, quite misleading if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: i seen it all now lls
Reviews.Author: unknown
Reviews.Content: this phone doesn't even look like the samsung galaxy 2 from sprint and t-mobile version of it LOL anyways I LOVE MY HTC ONE which is 10x better than this crap #TRUTH

Reviews.Title: its a fraud
Reviews.Author: thabatta
Reviews.Content: i consider you should warn customers about your limited service only in USA, the phone is not unlocked for use in another country, and make money back to customer who are dissatisfied with the product and its inability

Reviews.Title: Scam
Reviews.Author: Michael C. Roach "Scottyc1776"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone and a NET10 card and cannot even activate the phone.  Very bad product and service.  I am returning to Amazon for refund and will not ever go with this company ever again.  They try to get you to go the auto refill route with your credit or debit card.  Total crap.

ProductInfo.Features:
Android 2.3 Gingerbread Platform With Access to over 500,000 Apps Via Google Play Store
4.3 inch WVGA Super Amoled Display
8.0 Megapixel Camera with Auto Focus and LED Flash and 2.0 Megapixel Front-Facing Camera
HSPDA+/WI-FI Connectivity
Powerful 1.2GHz Dual Core Processor
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung Galaxy S II Android Prepaid Phone (Net10)
